title: Update regarding Quantum Compute
story_body:
Tech sector bagholders are getting crushed as industry-wide shortages send shockwaves through the supply chain. Quantum Compute (QNTM) is just the latest casualty, but make no mistake, this is a sector issue, not a company-specific problem.

The entire tech space is feeling the pinch as shortages of critical components like memory chips and graphics cards are crippling production. QNTM, which was supposed to be a moonshot stock, is now struggling to get its products out the door. The stock price is taking a beating, and longs are getting squeezed.

But here's the thing: this isn't a QNTM problem, it's a tech problem. Every major player is feeling the effects of these shortages, from the giants like Intel and AMD to the smaller players like QNTM. It's a perfect storm of demand outstripping supply, and it's going to take a while to work itself out.

So, what's a trader to do? Well, if you're a QNTM long, you're probably feeling pretty frustrated right now. But don't panic. This too shall pass. The company is still fundamentally sound, and the demand for its products is still there. It's just a matter of waiting for the supply chain to catch up.

In the meantime, keep an eye on the sector as a whole. If you're feeling bold, you could try picking up some of the other tech stocks that are getting hit hard. Just remember, when the sector is this oversold, it's only a matter of time before it bounces back. And when it does, you don't want to be left on the sidelines.

So, QNTM bagholders, don't lose faith just yet. This too shall pass, and when it does, your stock will be back on its way to the moon.
